body_content.explanation: a border that surrounds and supports a picture, door, or window:
the plastic or metal structure that holds together a pair of glasses:
examples: I think I need glasses with bigger frames.

body_content.explanation: the basic structure of a building, vehicle, or piece of furniture that other parts are added onto:
a wooden or plastic triangle used to put the balls into position at the start of a game such as snooker
the size and shape of someone's body:
examples: My sister has a much bigger frame than me.

body_content.explanation: the way someone thinks or feels about something at a particular time:
examples: The most important thing is to go into the exam in a positive frame of mind.

body_content.explanation: a set of ideas or facts accepted by a person that explains their behaviour, opinions, or decisions:
examples: How can Christians and atheists ever come to understand each other when their frames of reference are so different?

body_content.explanation: a period of play in some games, such as snooker andbowling:
examples: She lost the next two frames.

body_content.explanation: a playing period in a game of baseball during which one team bats (= hits the ball):
examples: They scored four runs in the top frame (= the first half of the inning).
East Carolina responded in the bottom frame (= the second half of the inning) with a run to tie the game, 3-3.

body_content.explanation: one of the pictures on a strip of photographic film, or one of the single pictures that together form a television or cinema film
to express something choosing your words carefully:
examples: The interview would have been more productive if the questions had been framed more precisely.

body_content.explanation: to make a person seem to be guilty of a crime when they are not, by producing facts or information that are not true:
examples: He claimed he'd been framed by the police.

body_content.explanation: to fix a border around a picture, etc. and often glass in front of it:
examples: I keep meaning to get that photo framed.

body_content.explanation: to form an edge to something in an attractive way:
examples: Her new hairstyle frames her face in a much more flattering way.
